comments: The p=9 member of the p-family of sequences {(n+p-1)!/p!}, n >= 1.The asymptotic expansion of the higher order exponential integral E(x,m=1,n=10) ~ exp(-x)/x*(1 - 10/x + 110/x^2 - 1320/x^3 + 17160/x^4 - 240240/x^5 + 3603600/x^6 - ...) leads to the sequence given above. See A163931 and A130534 for more information. - _Johannes W. Meijer_, Oct 20 2009a(n) = A173333(n+9,9). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 19 2010a(n) = A245334(n+9,n) / 10. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 31 2014
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..300
prog: (MAGMA) [Factorial(n+9)/362880: n in [0..25]]; // Vincenzo Librandi, Jul 20 2011(PARI) a(n) = (n+9)!/9!(Haskell)a049398 = (flip div 362880) . a000142 . (+ 9)-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 31 2014
